snippet: Sony reported a loss of 24.6 billion yen for the April-to-June quarter and lowered its full-year earnings forecast. It has posted losses for four straight years.
abstract: Sony reports fiscal first-quarter loss of 24.6 billion yen ($315 million), compared with a 15.5 billion yen loss in the year-ago quarter; revenue rose 1.4 percent to 1.52 trillion yen ($19.4 billion); lowers its earnings forecast for its fiscal year ending in March 2013 to 20 billion yen ($256 million), down from 30 billion yen.

headline.main: Sony Cites Weak LCD Sales and a Strong Yen in Its Loss
headline.print_headline: Sony Cites Weak LCD Sales And a Strong Yen in Its Loss

snippet: “Joan Miró,” with 160 or so works from 1917 to 1974, is a beautiful and exciting show at the National Gallery of Art.
abstract: Ken Johnson reviews exhibit Joan Miro: The Ladder of Escape at the National Gallery of Art.

headline.main: Filtering Miró’s Work Through a Political Sieve
headline.print_headline: Filtering Miró’s Work Through a Political Sieve

snippet: Should we just accept that when you buy a new computer, you should buy it for what it does now, and learn not to resent the fact that, inevitably, there will be better, faster, cheaper computers in the future?
abstract: Should we just accept that when you buy a new computer, you should buy it for what it does now, and learn not to resent the fact that, inevitably, there will be better, faster, cheaper computers in the future?

headline.main: Apple AirPlay and the Window of Obsolescence

snippet: Certain popular books are not available in an electronic version. Publishers are leaving money on the table.

headline.main: Where Is Bourne? Not in an Electronic Version

snippet: Pummeled by the slow global economy, exchange rate shifts and the euro zone crisis, Sony reported a 77 percent slide in operating profit, far below expectations for the quarter.

headline.main: Sony's Quarterly Profit Sinks, Hit by Weak Demand

snippet: Q.     Apple killed off the service, but I still have this iDisk icon in the list of drives in my Mac's window. It gives me an error every time I accidentally click on it, so can I just remove it?
abstract: Personal Tech Q&A column on removing the iDisk icon from the Mac's sidebar. (S)h

headline.main: Q&A: Cleaning Up The Mac's Sidebar

snippet: EXCHANGE DEAL The Maple Group, a consortium of Canadian financial firms and pension funds, has acquired 91 percent of the shares in the TMX Group, securing its $3.7 billion buyout of the Canadian exchange operator.      Wednesday's announcement en...
abstract: DealBook Online; Maple Group acquires 91 percent of the TMX Group, securing its $3.7 billion buyout; Credit Suisse names David DeNunzio as global chairman of its mergers and acquisitions group; Apple's proposed $356 million acquisition of AuthenTec is unusual because of how little AuthenTec is saying about the deal.
